channel.title: 🔥 Open Data hot twitter posts | by onData
channel.description: Tweets about open data, which have received at least 10 hearts or retweets, in many languages

item.title: #en @ 1524191092752609280
item.description:
Police have shot and killed 368 people so far in 2022 (an average of 2.9 per day). Houston, TX leads the nation with 6 fatal police shootings this year.
@houstonpolice #wapo #dataanalysis #twitterbot #policeshooting #cops #bot #opendata #stats #publicrecords #reform

item.title: #es @ 1524177465748250624
item.description: 📺No te pierdas el programa #DerechoASaber con @nayaroldan, entérate qué son y para qué sirven los #DatosAbiertos. ¡Tenemos una cita! 👇 🗓️ miércoles 11 de mayo ⏰22:00 horas 📺 @CanalCongreso 45.1 y Redes sociales del @INAImexico https://t.co/ZelXhen7J1

item.title: #es @ 1524158682262650880
item.description:
Por lo que no sabremos la evolución de los contagios hasta el día 16 de mayo que liberen nuevamente la base de datos abiertos, dicha base presentará corte de la información hasta el 14 de mayo.
Se comparten datos cada 7 días pero 2 días desactualizados.

item.title: #en @ 1524146044371861504
item.description: Do research participants (mTurk & uni students) care if we p-hack or file drawer their data? Do they have opinions about open data, or open access publishing? Do we have an obligation to meet their expectations about how their data will (& won’t) be used? Read @julia_gb’s paper! https://t.co/weogcWFtSU

item.title: #ja @ 1524142215802634242
item.description: 昨日からInternational Businessで、ある会社の海外参入国を選んで戦略を作る課題に集中。私にとって馴染み薄いエリアから選ばなくちゃいけないのでいろんなデータを集めてるのだけどWould BankのOpen dataサイトは情報量もありがたいし、何より使いやすくて素敵。関係ないデータもどんどん見ちゃう🫠 https://t.co/7WyRlHTSQo

item.title: #es @ 1524116501791481860
item.description: La presentación y los datos abiertos estarán en https://t.co/Y72LmKbf42 El equipo del proyecto @niunamuertevial agradece infinitamente a las y los familiares de víctimas y activistas que han convertido su dolor en accion, para que nunca nadie más tenga que pasar por lo mismo 💜💛

item.title: #en @ 1524116412729643010
item.description: 1/3 Re the open data discussions, it is interesting to see how much people differentiate between data, tools for analyzing data, and tools for collecting data. Datasets are given a special status per the intellectual labor that goes into developing them. But what about tools?

item.title: #en @ 1524093869595394049
item.description:
My take on the open data debate:
The original author(s) should always be contacted and invited to collaborate.
It isn’t about ownership; it’s that the person or team that spearheaded the data collection has, in most cases, already made a substantive intellectual contribution.

item.title: #en @ 1524089135971110913
item.description:
Are there any open data sets, from surveys of researchers’ motivations to share data? #OpenScience
(I know this question sounds tongue in cheek but I am really asking.)

item.title: #en @ 1524087721500626945
item.description: $NWBO The presentation didn’t start until 11:10 est but the stock started dumping from the open. Data was good so couldn’t have been a leak. Likely some manipulation going on. Not mad since I picked up more shares. @FlemmingBruce Thank you for you DD. It’s not over

item.title: #en @ 1524085611425976320
item.description:
Super late to this convo today, but I wanted to give some thoughts on open data. No judgement here, just my personal views.
First, I don't think I own my data and I don't think you own your data. If we're talking about psychology or psychiatry, the public own the data. 1/13

item.title: #en @ 1524071261743325184
item.description: Open science is here and implementation of open data and methods is key for research progress. ⁦@ISMRM⁩ Member Initiated Symposium “The reproducibility crisis” ⁦@cassgvp⁩ ⁦@SerenaBonaretti⁩ #ISMRM22 https://t.co/aZ3SYd6C9f

item.title: #en @ 1524066257846296576
item.description:
@yannaweisberg @ashleylwatts @KMKing_Psych @LisaStarrPhD i'll add another take: open data allows researchers who might not have the resource to collect such data benefit from those who can
if we want to provide equity, then providing open data is a great way to break down systemic issues related to collecting it

item.title: #en @ 1524056776378834945
item.description:
Launch alert 📢 Excited to release https://t.co/tP4OGgCnmZ with @JonahTh0mas. It is an open data project that will hopefully help researchers with an interest in health behaviours to learn R.
What is health_stack? 🧵(1/9) #health_stack #rstats #DataScience

item.title: #de @ 1524034595833978880
item.description:

item.title: #fr @ 1524022776482480129
item.description: #CommandePublique 📢La plateforme APProch' ouvrira en juin et permettra aux #acheteurspublics de publier leurs données de programmation achat. Et aux entreprises d'en prendre connaissance afin de planifier leurs plans de charge pour soumissionner à des #marchéspublics #opendata

item.title: #en @ 1524020779544977410
item.description:
@AleksaKaurin As an author, I would like it if I was contacted before someone published with some of my open data, but I wouldn’t feel wronged if they didn’t, granted they appropriately cited the parent work.
2/2

item.title: #en @ 1524020629711855619
item.description:
@AleksaKaurin As a data downloader, my assumption is if they’re open, I’m free to do what I want with a data set. E.g., I’ve highlighted open data sets in some of my blog posts without asking the prior research team beforehand.
1/2

item.description: aprovecho de felicitar a los que están detrás de la plataforma de datos abiertos de la convención. veo que tienen endpoints para consultar varias cosas, además de estar disponibles los artículos ya aprobados por el pleno. https://t.co/vi92Xtv45Q

item.title: #en @ 1523980152937631744
item.description:
@AleksaKaurin Short answer: yes ok to publish.
Seen situations where open data were reused & some original authors (medicine) were upset they weren’t asked for permission. I don’t think this is an understanding we have in psychology with open data. If data is open they can be used imo.

item.title: #en @ 1523968597550374914
item.description:
New analysis by @TransitionZero shows it’s cheaper to go straight from coal to renewable energy (wind, solar + battery storage) than coal-to-gas.
This is down to the HUGE fall in RE costs and the volatility of gas prices.
https://t.co/HUaw10SGUg #Coal2Clean #OpenData https://t.co/LYdnKbMDYQ

item.title: #en @ 1523967374885490688
item.description: We have just published a new study on how to make #data from https://t.co/cI11Rrk9Po more reusable. item.title: #en @ 1523908406868058112
item.description:
I think it's fair to say we (the reserach field) solve a couple of problems:
1. open research output 2. interoperability
FAIR and Open data is reality and beyond the hype. It's just adoption that is lacking.
Deep Learning already knows this. They're at full speed. 1/

item.title: #es @ 1523836029635117058
item.description: @andreucomas14 @HLGatell Cada lunes se publicarán datos abiertos por día y el informe técnico, asimismo, cualquier epidemiólogo sabe que los datos de la última semana aún son inestables y que el día 8 no habrá datos de los días 6 y 7 (por su ejemplo). Espero que le sirva la información. Saludos.

item.description: Jornada veraniega en la Bahía.
